could break my fall from happiness to
misery; it was as the stroke of
lightneg lightning – sudden and
entire. Alas! I now met frowns where
before I had been welcomed only with
smiles: he, my beloved father, shunned
me, and either treated me with harsh-
ness or a more heart-breaking coldness.

-ble emotions that he exhibited drove
me to silence and tears.
